meanings.definition: Lemmatize: to group together the different inflected forms of a word so they can be analyzed as a single item
meanings.sent1: I lemmatize the words to make them easier to study.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often lemmatize words to simplify their analysis.
meanings.sent3: The computer tried to lemmatize the words, but got confused and mixed them up.
meanings.sent4: She lemmatized the data, bringing order to the chaos of words.
meanings.sent5: Lemmatizing the words helped me see patterns I hadn't noticed before.

meanings.definition: Lemmatize: to determine the base or root form of a word
meanings.sent1: Can you lemmatize this word to find its original form?
meanings.sent2: It is important to lemmatize words to understand their structure better.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to lemmatize the cryptic message to uncover its hidden meaning.
meanings.sent4: Lemmatizing the word was like peeling back layers to reveal its true essence.
meanings.sent5: She lemmatized the word, revealing its ancient origins.
